outputs.output_descr:
Africa-Asia SME (Small and Medium Enterprises) Network is designed to promote SME development in Africa through:
i) creation of TECHNONET Africa 
ii) learning from the experience of Asia

 TECHNONET Africa is implemented initially in  7 countries namely Cameroon, Ghana, Mozambique, Nigeria, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda. The countries are represented by 10 SME umbrella institutions from government and private sectors referred to as "Participating Organizations". The areas of focus are agro-based, food processing and metallurgy.

The outcome areas:
- TECHNONET Africa established and effectively managed by Participating Organizations to run planned activities;
- Government Policy and institution for SME development reformed; 
- Capacity of Participating Organizations strengthened to promote trade and investment of SMEs

project_descr: Asia-Africa Small and Medium Enterprises Network
project_title: Asia-Africa Small and Medium Enterprises Network
